items.name: Component_LayoutBehavior
items.content:
# =================================================================== # # Script: Component_LayoutBehavior # # $$COPYRIGHT$$ # # =================================================================== class Component_LayoutBehavior extends gs.Component_Visual ###* * The base class of all layout-components. A layout-component is used * to layout assigned sub-objects in a specific way depending on the layout-type. * For example: A grid-layout layouts its sub-objects like a grid using rows * and columns. The game object needs a container-component.

* * A layout can also be configured as scrollable. In that case, layout's content * can be larger than the layout-bounds and is automatically clipped. The content * can be scrolled using mouse-wheel or touch-gesture. * * @module gs * @class Component_LayoutBehavior * @extends gs.Component * @memberof gs * @constructor ### constructor: -> ###* * Content size of the layout. * @property contentSize * @type gs.Size * @readOnly ### @contentSize = width: 0, height: 0 ###* * Disposes the layout and all its sub-objects. * * @method dispose ### # FIXME: Is that still necessary? If the parent game object is disposed # all sub-objects are disposed as well. dispose: -> for control in @object.controls control?.dispose() ###* * Initializes the layout. * * @method setup ### setup: -> ###* * Sizes the layout to fit its content. * * @method sizeToFit * @abstract ### sizeToFit: -> ###* * Sort-Function to sort sub-objects by order-index. * * @method sort_ * @protected * @param {gs.Object_Base} a Object A * @param {gs.Object_Base} b Object B ### sort_: (a, b) -> if a.order > b.order return -1 else if a.order < b.order return 1 else return 0 ###* * Updates a specified control. * * @method updateControl * @protected * @param {gs.Object_Base} control The control to update ### updateControl: (control) -> @object.rIndex = Math.max(@object.rIndex, control.rIndex) if control.updateBehavior == ui.UpdateBehavior.CONTINUOUS control.needsUpdate = yes if control.inheritProperties control.ui.enabled = @object.ui.enabled control.opacity = @object.opacity control.zoom = @object.zoom control.color = @object.color control.tone = @object.tone control.angle = @object.angle control.anchor.x = @object.anchor.x control.anchor.y = @object.anchor.y if control.needsUpdate control.needsUpdate = no control.update() control.parent = @object if @object.clipRect? control.clipRect = @object.clipRect ###* * Updates the content size of the layout. Only works if scrolling is * enabled. * * @method updateContentSize * @protected ### updateContentSize: -> if @object.scrollable @contentSize.width = 0 @contentSize.height = 0 for control in @object.controls if control @contentSize.width += control.margin.left + control.dstRect.width + control.margin.right @contentSize.height += control.margin.top + control.dstRect.height + control.margin.bottom @object.contentHeight = @contentSize.height @object.contentWidth = @contentSize.width ###* * Updates scrolling. * * @method updateScroll ### updateScroll: -> if @object.scrollable @object.scrollableHeight = Math.max(0, @contentSize.height - @object.dstRect.height) if Input.Mouse.wheel <= -1 @object.scrollOffsetY = Math.max(@object.scrollOffsetY - Input.Mouse.wheelSpeed * 0.1, 0) if Input.Mouse.wheel >= 1 @object.scrollOffsetY = Math.min(@object.scrollOffsetY - Input.Mouse.wheelSpeed * 0.1, @object.scrollableHeight) @object.scrollOffsetY = Math.max(Math.min(@object.scrollOffsetY, @object.scrollableHeight), 0) ###* * Updates the layout's content. * * @method updateContent ### updateContent: -> ###* * Updates the layout. * * @method update ### update: -> super @updateContentSize() @updateScroll() #if @object.needsSort # @object.subObjects.sort(@sort_) # @object.needsSort = no gs.Component_LayoutBehavior = Component_LayoutBehavior
